sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: A full translation of all packages which prompt users during a default install of a Debian desktop system belong to level 5 of &d-i; localization.

This includes the following Debian packages:
menu
xorg-x11
debconf (debconf)

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The menu Debian package provides all window managers, in graphical environments, a standard menu to organize the applications launch shortcuts.
The most important items to translate in menu are the menu section names.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: This package is a regular Debian package. The package maintenance team uses a CVS repository.
This package's localization material is spread over two files. These are, by order of importance:

listitem.para: po/*.po: program translations. The maintainers unfortunately does not keep a templates file in their repositories, so translators should pick up another PO file as a reference to create their own translation file.
po-sections/po/menu-sections.pot: names of the menu sections, which group together the shortcuts for the various programs.
CVS access: &cvs-menu;, po-sections directory (menu sections translations) and po-sections directory (program translations)

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the menu package.

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The xorg-x11 Debian package provides the X-Window System environment which is by far the most common graphical environment of Unix systems.
This package is installed on all desktop systems. It asks, during its installation several questions to users abou ttheir hardware, in order to properly setup the X server configuration file.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: This package is a regular Debian package. The package maintenance team uses a SVN repository.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the xorg-x11 package.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: The screens are likely to be seen by all users installing desktop systems. Translators should avoid jargon in these translations.

sect3.title: Package description
sect3.para: The debconf Debian package is the program which handles all configuration steps of other packages when these packages need some user interaction while they are configured.

This package is installed on all Debian systems. Its installation process usually inputs the user about the default priority of questions. However, when installed in a normal &d-i; installation process, these answers are pre-filled with the priority settings of the installation process. As a consequence, the questions are usually hidden from users.
However, as the package is a key Debian package, its translation is important for a properly localized system.

sect3.title: Files location and access methods
sect3.para: The package uses a SVN repository. Commit access may be requested to the &i18n-coords;. However, as the translatable parts do not change very often, getting commit access is not highly useful.

sect3.title: Updating/Adding translations
sect3.para: Translations should be reported as bugs against the debconf package.

sect3.title: Specific recommendations
sect3.para: The translations are very similar to the questions asked by the cdebconf package, which is part of the level1 of &d-i; translations.

Translators should then be careful about using the same terminology in both packages, especially for questions priorities. This can be done by merging the translations from &d-i; level1 into debconf translations.
